DataElement.preferredName: Microwave Ablation Temperature Celsius Scale Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value for the temperature of heat (in Celsius) used for a microwave ablation therapy session.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A type of treatment in which body tissue is exposed to high temperatures to damage and kill cancer cells or to make cancer cells more sensitive to the effects of radiation and certain anticancer drugs._Removal of a part, pathway, or function by surgery, chemical destruction, electrocautery, or radiofrequency. (Taber's)_the degree of hotness or coldness of a body or environment.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A type of treatment in which body tissue is exposed to high temperatures to damage and kill cancer cells or to make cancer cells more sensitive to the effects of radiation and certain anticancer drugs.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure in which microwave irradiation is used for the purpose of heating and destroying the surrounding tissue.

Property.preferredDefinition: Removal of a part, pathway, or function by surgery, chemical destruction, electrocautery, or radiofrequency. (Taber's):the degree of hotness or coldness of a body or environment.

Concepts.definition: Removal, separation, detachment, extirpation, or eradication of a body part, pathway, or function by surgery, chemical destruction, morbid process, or noxious substance.

A measure of the average kinetic energy of a system of particles. Temperature may be quantified, in the context of thermodynamics, as the potential of one system to transfer thermal energy to another system until both systems reach a state of thermal equilibrium.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The temperature scale defined by the values 0 degree Celsius for the freezing point of water and 100 degrees Celsius for the boiling point of water.  The Celsius degree (C) is the same size as a Kelvin and equal to (F - 32)/1.8._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The temperature scale defined by the values 0 degree Celsius for the freezing point of water and 100 degrees Celsius for the boiling point of water.¿ The Celsius degree (C) is the same size as a Kelvin and equal to (F - 32)/1.8.¿ To convert Celsius to Fahrenheit units, one can use the following formula: (C x 9/5 + 32).:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The temperature scale defined by the values 0 degree Celsius for the freezing point of water and 100 degrees Celsius for the boiling point of water.  The Celsius degree (C) is the same size as a Kelvin and equal to (F - 32)/1.8.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated for St. Joseph Orange trial
